flawed_nl_solution:
30 x 1/5 = <<30*1/5=150/1>>150/1 students like Math.
30 x 1/3 = <<30*1/3=10>>10 students like English.
So, 150/1 + 10 = <<150/1+10=160>>160 students like either Math or English.
Thus, 30 - 160 = <<30-160=-130>>-130 students neither like Math nor English.
Since 1/7 of the remaining like Science, therefore -130 x 1/7 = <<-130*1/7=-130/7>>-130/7 students like Science.
Hence, -130 - -130/7 = <<-130--130/7=-780/7>>-780/7 students neither likes the 3 subjects.
#### -780/7

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 6, not 150/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
